actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.Con.Res. 24 (Rep. Case):
        A concurrent resolution authorizing the use of Emancipation Hall in the Capitol Visitor Center for an event to celebrate the birthday of King Kamehameha I.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S. 201 (Sen. Kelly):
        A bill to provide for a study by the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine on the prevalence and mortality of cancer among individuals who served as active duty aircrew in the Armed Forces, and for other purposes.

        -- Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 2296 (Sen. Kelly):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 2296 proposed by Senator Moran for Senator Kelly.

        --Amendment SA 2296 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

PN17:
        Michael Duffey, of Virginia, to be Under Secretary of Defense for Acquisition and Sustainment

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 46. Record Vote Number: 283 



 PN22-16:
        Dale Marks, of Florida, to be an Assistant Secretary of Defense

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 28. Record Vote Number: 286 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 72 - 26. Record Vote Number: 287 



 PN25-19:
        Allison Hooker, of Georgia, to be an Under Secretary of State (Political Affairs)

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 59 - 37. Record Vote Number: 284 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 59 - 36. Record Vote Number: 285 



 PN26-16:
        John Andrew Eisenberg, of Virginia, to be an Assistant Attorney General

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN26-43:
        Brett Shumate, of Virginia, to be an Assistant Attorney General

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Moran, at  6:08 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
